Articles.Content: Is there a known issue of a work around for when you cannot get a node for a mid course correct?  I only seem to have this issue with Interstellar flights.  I have tried to go to the Space Center and back and I still cannot create a node.  I have also tried to create one past the APO , but still no avail.
You'd be better off asking in Technical Support (modded).

Man is that frustrating.

Occasionally the game will allow you to place a node on the purple (next) orbit line.  If it does you can grab that node and carefully circle it back around the orbit and get it onto the blue orbit line where you want it.  This doesn't always work, but sometimes does.  

Hope this helps.

Edited July 19, 2016 by Aethon
Was able to fix this last night by swapping to a different ship and then back.  Node placement restored.

1 hour ago, klesh said:

Was able to fix this last night by swapping to a different ship and then back.  Node placement restored.  

I confirm this workaround works. But this darn bug has been around since I bought the game in version 0.22. Wish it would get squashed!
F5/F9 usually fixes that. And to fix the "stuck on the purple orbit" I use PreciseNode's -orbit button.

7 minutes ago, Aethon said:

Hmmm.  Can you flesh that out a bit.  I use PreciseNode as well.  -orbit button?

Go into the options (O button at the top) and turn on everything that doesn't open a new window. Among the many many buttons you'll unlock will be buttons to jump forward and backward an orbit. They're a LITTLE redundant now that you can do it in the stock game, but one thing they will do that the stock game won't do is jump back to the current orbit when the game refuses to do so, in cases like this.
I use the O to expand the window but I guess I've never noticed that feature.  Thanks for the info.
one thing i do that seems to always work, aslong as you have an intercept already, is to focus on your target where you often can.  then refocus on the ship and pull it back to where i want it

If your using Career, for a Certian tracking station, you can only have a certain number of maneuvered nodes.

Here is a mod that I would recommend for all those people who use maneuvered nodes regularly.

Precise node uses very pin-pointed measuring devices to make your maneuvered node as accurate as possible. It include keyboard shortcuts ( Without command ) and can also change how much you increase your prograde, retrograde, and other directions.
